Utterance: Hi again! It’s great to see you back. How have you been since our last session?
Hi Ellie! I’ve been doing pretty well, thanks for asking.
That’s good to hear. Last time, you mentioned you were happy most of the time. Have there been any moments since then that stood out to you?
Actually, yes! I went to a really great concert last weekend. The energy was amazing.
That sounds wonderful! What did you enjoy most about it?
Just being surrounded by people who love the same music. It felt really uplifting.
Music seems to play a significant role in your life. How does it make you feel overall?
It’s like therapy for me. I can express myself through it, and it helps me relax.
That’s a powerful connection. Have you had any moments recently where music helped you through a tough time?
Hmm, I think so. There was a day I felt a bit stressed about work, and I put on some of my favorite songs. It really shifted my mood.
That’s a great coping strategy. It sounds like you’re aware of what helps you. Have you been able to use that strategy more often?
Yes, I’ve been trying to incorporate music into my daily routine, especially when I feel overwhelmed.
That’s fantastic! It’s important to have those tools. You also mentioned playing golf and swimming. Have you had the chance to engage in those activities?
I played golf last weekend too! It was a nice way to unwind.
How did that feel for you?
It felt refreshing. Being outdoors really helps clear my mind.
It sounds like you have a good balance of activities that support your well-being. Are there any challenges you’ve faced recently?
I’ve been a bit stressed about some upcoming projects at work. It feels like there’s a lot on my plate.
That’s understandable. How do you typically manage that stress?
I try to break things down into smaller tasks, but sometimes it feels overwhelming.
Breaking things down is a great strategy. Have you considered setting specific time blocks for each task?
I haven’t really done that. I usually just tackle things as they come.
It might be worth trying. Setting aside dedicated time for each project could help you feel more in control. How do you think you would feel about implementing that?
I think it could help. I like the idea of having a clear plan.
Great! Let’s set that as a goal for the week. We can check in on how it worked for you next time.
Sounds good!
You also mentioned your family last time. Have you had any recent interactions with them?
Yes, I visited my parents last weekend. It was nice to catch up.
That’s wonderful. How did that go?
We had a great time. We talked about everything, and it felt good to connect.
It’s nice to have that support. Do you feel comfortable expressing your feelings with them?
Yes, I do. It’s always been an open relationship.
That’s a blessing. It’s important to have that kind of support system. Is there anything specific you’d like to work on in our future sessions?
Maybe exploring more coping strategies for stress and anxiety. I think it could be beneficial.
Absolutely! We can focus on that. Would you be open to trying some mindfulness exercises in our next session?
Yes, I’d like that!
Perfect! I’ll prepare some techniques for us to explore. Is there anything else on your mind today?
No, I think that covers it for now.
Alright! Thank you for sharing today. I look forward to hearing about your week and how the new strategies work for you.
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate it.
Take care, and see you next time!
Bye!
